trans-unit.source: Represents a parser error or warning.
This class cannot be inherited.
A ParserError object represents an error that is created when an <xref:System.Web.HttpParseException> exception is thrown.
A parser error object can contain error message text, a virtual path to the file where the error occurred, and the subsequent line number of the error in that file.
If more than one parser error occurs or you want to store multiple parser errors in a centralized location, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> object.
A parser error is of the type <xref:System.Web.HttpException>.
For more information on exceptions and how to handle them, go to [MSDN Library](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37118).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> class by using the specified error text, virtual path, and source line number.
Use the ParserError constructor to initialize a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object with custom settings.

The ParserError constructor has the following properties: - The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.ErrorText%2A> property, which is a string containing the error message that is related to the parser error.
- The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.VirtualPath%2A> property, which is a read-only string that specifies the virtual path of the file that contains the parser error.
- The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.Line%2A> property, whichis the line number within the file at which this <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object was thrown.
The error message text.
The virtual path of the file being parsed when the error occurred.
The line number of the error source.
Gets or sets a string that represents the error for the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object.
Use the ErrorText property to provide a programmer-defined error message for parser errors for display in a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object.
A string containing the error message.
Gets or sets the line number of the source at which the error occurs.
The Line propertyis the line number within the file at which this <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object was thrown.
The source line number where the parser encountered the error.
Gets or set the virtual path of the file that was being parsed when the error occurred.
A string that specifies the virtual path of the file that contains the parser error.
